title-group.article-title: New Ablative Heat Shield Materials for Mars Landers

abstract.p: Two new ablative materials, designated SLA-741 and SLA-561, have been developed by Martin Marietta for Mars Lander thermal protection. The density range of these ablators isO. 18-0.22 g/cc and is substantially lower than that of other types of low density charring ablators. Plasma arc testing conducted in a simulated Mars atmosphere has established that SLA ablators are considerably more efficient than conventional ablators such as filled silicone, low density nylonphenolic, or corkboard and that they form sturdy, erosion resistant chars.
